gameDetails.matchup: Kansas City Chiefs at Dallas Cowboys

recentPerformance.cushion: Getting +3 at home vs struggling road team

keyFactors.title: Chiefs Road Struggles
keyFactors.description: Kansas City 1-4 on the road this season - major regression from recent years

keyFactors.title: Thanksgiving History
keyFactors.description: Cowboys 34-22-1 all-time on Thanksgiving, franchise thrives in spotlight

keyFactors.title: PRO Model Edge
keyFactors.description: VectorFund model showing 3.5% edge on this line

keyFactors.title: Line Value
keyFactors.description: Getting +3 and +100 odds represents solid value

quarterBreakdown.description: Tight game early, both teams feeling each other out
Cowboys took first lead, Malik Davis 43-yard TD run
Back and forth, Cowboys maintaining slim advantage
Cowboys held on for 31-28 victory, covered by winning outright

gameResults.whenCleared: Won outright by 3 - covered the spread easily
gameResults.turningPoint: Malik Davis 43-yard TD run swung momentum to Dallas

whatWentRight.title: Home Dominance
whatWentRight.description: Cowboys thrived in Thanksgiving spotlight as expected

whatWentRight.title: Chiefs Road Woes Continue
whatWentRight.description: KC dropped to 1-5 on road - thesis confirmed

whatWentRight.title: Dak Stepped Up
whatWentRight.description: Prescott delivered 320 yards and 2 TDs in big spot

statisticalContext.vsRecentForm: Cowboys building momentum with 3rd straight win

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: Thesis played out perfectly. Chiefs road struggles continued and Cowboys delivered at home on Thanksgiving.

closingLineValue.verdict: Captured closing line value - line moved toward Cowboys

keyTakeaways: Chiefs road struggles are real and exploitable
Getting +3 with plus money was excellent value
verdict: Clean win. Cowboys won outright 31-28, covering the +3 spread easily. Chiefs road woes continued as predicted.
